discussion.content: A RADIUS Client (or Network Access Server) is a networking device that is used to authenticate users. A RADIUS Server is a background process that runs on a UNIX or Windows server. It lets you maintain user profiles in a central database.

questions.question_text: Which of the following server types should be used to process outside authentication requests?

A user in a multitenant office building is having issues connecting to company printers and shares but is able to connect to the Internet via WiFi. Which of the following should a technician do FIRST when troubleshooting this issue?

discussion.content: A. the user may use guest-wifi, therefore, the company's printer and share can't be accesed. The first step is to check if the ssid is the company-wifi, rather than guest-wifi.

Selected Answer: A
A is a good choice. May be you are connected with the guest WLAN
I would go with A... then B.

This question is similar to another question...
I think A and B are both good choices, A is the Next easiest thing to do, if the SSID looks ok and not on a guest wifi, the next best option is check the Ethernet cables in case the shares and printers are connected via LAN.
Both A and B seem right.........no idea
b is ok
but is able to connect to the Internet via WiFi meaning he is not using the ethernet which has the shares on them

choices.A: Check which SSID is in use.
choices.B: Test the connections with an Ethernet cable.

questions.question_text: A customer has procured extra money in the budget for a new server. The customer wants to update the infrastructure so devices will be matched against a database of company assets and allowed or denied access to resources on the network. Which of the following server types should a technician install?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
An authentication server provides a network service that applications use to authenticate the credentials, usually account names and passwords, of their users.

questions.question_text: A company requires the ability to control, optimize, and report user network storage automatically. Which of the following cloud concepts can achieve this?

discussion.content: Surely this is B

rapid elasticity - The ability to scale cloud computing
resources quickly to meet peak demand
and just as quickly remove resources if
they are not currently needed.

Measured service Resources are measured through metering on a per use basis.
The metering measurement is based on the type of resource
such as storage, processing, bandwidth, or active users. The
metering mechanism should be accessible to the customer via a
reporting dashboard, providing complete transparency in usage
and billing.

So ans is B
its B for sure

Selected Answer: B
Measured

I think it is C, the company wants "the ability to control and optimize"... so with on-demand self service the customer can control the services they want by requesting it using an online control panel.

On-demand self service refers to the service provided by cloud computing vendors that enables the provision of cloud resources on demand whenever they are required. In on-demand self service, the user accesses cloud services through an online control panel.

https://www.techopedia.com/definition/27915/on-demand-self-service
Update.....i think its A
Pretty sure its C....
I Think the answer is C

a burning smell can come from the power supply or from a capacitor on the motherboard. Since the motherboard is not an offered answer here, only the PSU remains.
PSU. The answer is correct. Though not available in this list, motherboard is also an option.

questions.question_text: A user's workstation no longer boots. A technician arrives and confirms the workstation will not boot, and while troubleshooting notices a burning smell coming from the chassis of the workstation. The technician replaces the power cable and tries to boot again, but the smell returns and the machine does not boot. Which of the following components MOST likely needs to be replaced?
